summary: This is an internal DOJ email regarding logistical planning for a survivor briefing event. It includes a spreadsheet of victim invitees and cautions about using correct name spellings for travel arrangements.

persons.name: Senior Policy Counsel
persons.context: Author of the email, coordinating logistics for a DOJ survivor briefing event and managing the victim invitee list.

events.title: DOJ Survivor Briefing Planning
events.description: Internal DOJ email correspondence regarding logistical planning for a survivor briefing event, including management of a victim invitee list and travel arrangements.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Civil Rights Division, 150 M St NE, Room 7.112, Washington DC 20002
keyFacts: The DOJ's Human Trafficking Prosecution Unit was organizing a survivor briefing event as of October 2020.
A master list of victim invitees was maintained in a spreadsheet, indicating coordinated outreach to Epstein victims.
The email highlights logistical care required for victim travel, specifically to use names as provided on official forms to avoid errors.
The correspondence is internal DOJ communication, showing ongoing official engagement with victims years after Epstein's death.
